definition[0]: to correct something that is wrong or unfair
example[0]: Little could be done to redress the situation.
example[1]: Affirmative action was meant to redress the balance  (=make the situation fair) for minorities.
definition[1]: money that someone pays you because they have caused you harm or damaged your property
example[2]: The only hope of redress is in a lawsuit.
definition[2]: something, especially money, that you want or get from someone because they have caused you harm or damaged your property
example[3]: She is seeking redress in the courts.
